data.title: Heart of Santa Fe
data.text: Can't imagine visiting Santa Fe without seeing the Plaza.  There are many interesting shops surrounding the plaza as well as some old beautiful hotels and charming restaurants and cafes.  Coming from the midwest we enjoyed the architecture in the Plaza and surrounding areas.

data.title: Cute plaza
data.text:
The Santa Fe Plaza is a nice place to just sit & people watch.  There were always vendors near by & there are blocks & blocks of shops.  There are even a few food vendors if you want to enjoy a lunch in the plaza.
We took a tour that was offered right off the plaza, it was ok, it was more of a "get to know what Santa Fe has to offer" tour than a history/informational tour.  But it was a nice way to see a little more without walking everywhere.

data.title: The Plaza and Environs Is Simply Enchanting
data.text: After dinner often Michael and I will walk around The Plaza slowly, browze through the wares of the few street vendors, and bookmark the shops we want to come back to the next day.  It is simply beautiful and very relaxing.  During the day The Plaza is wonderful and so are the fascinating side streets with the most remarkable shops and delightful restaurants.  All kinds of delights to enjoy.

data.title: History, Shopping, Taking in the Sights
data.text:
The Plaza is a fun area to people watch and take in the architecture of old New Mexico. For those interested in shopping, there are lots of choices around the plaza.
An especially enchanting time is Christmas!

data.title: Love this area of Santa Fe
data.text: The feel of this area is awesome, artsy and historic.  There are nice shops and eateries but expect the higher prices that touristy areas like this are known for.

data.title: There are a lots to see.
data.text: There are many shops and gallery's to check out, great places for food and fine dining. Parking is at a premium, so best to walk or take a shuttle.

data.title: Unbelievable Act of Kindness
data.text:
Wow! Love to sit and wander the Plaza when we visit.  People watching, enjoy gorgeous weather.  After a long stroll and bench sitting on Oct 21st, I returned to the motel to find my wallet missing!  Lost or stolen?  What a way to start the weekend.  While partner called the credit card companies, I tried to retrace our walk (impossible), looking in trash cans, hoping someone may have taken the money, and tossed the wallet.  Saw a policeman on the Plaza, and decided to mention it to him, and MAJOR SHOCK!!! He said he'd check with his partner and someone had turned one in, checked my name and address, AND - all the money, cards were still in it.  The other policeman said a man with a foreign accent found it under a bench in the Plaza.
Can you believe this miracle?  Endless thanks to the kind man who did this.  My husband and I knew we'd do the same, but you just don't think you'd luck out like this.  I am paying it forward!

data.title: Great shopping and seeing architectural history!
data.text: A nice stroll around the beautiful and scenic center of the city. There are restaurants, colorful shops and lots of trees and beautiful buildings to explore. A must for a Santa fe visit.

data.title: Pretty Average
data.text: This is an historic area that is said to come to life on the weekends.  We did not experiencence it on a weekend.  It is basically the central area, surrounded by shops of many varieties.  Nearby are museums and galleries, as well as places to eat.  Also nearby are some landmark churches and hotels.  But the plaza itself was nothing to get excited about.

data.title: Center point
data.text: The central point in Santa Fe that all must go to.  Great shops and restaurants all around.  The musicians also were entertaining.

data.title: Great Summer Concert Series
data.text: The Santa Fe Plaza is always hopping with activities. The summer concert series is a great value as it is free and includes music from all over the world. There are car shows, Spanish days, Indian market, Spanish market, art shows and artists galore, street musicians, and the old standby people watching. The Plaza is also home to the Native American only jewelry sellers who line the portal along the Governors Palace on the east end of the plaza. The plaza is lined with restaurants, shops, and galleries for every taste and budget; our favorite is the old Five and Dime and the rock shops.

data.title: Heart of the City
data.text: Truly the center of Santa Fe.  Pretty town square, lots of shade trees, street musicians, vendors.  Gathering spot for tourists and locals alike.

data.title: Downtown
data.text: The Plaza is the center of the city and is surrounded by just about every kind of shop and endulgence

data.title: interesting place
data.text: an interesting place for architecture, people watching, with a lot of shops, tourists, restaurants, museums and cafes

data.title: Filled with Panhandlers and Homeless
data.text: We spent the  Saturday morning yesterday walking around the plaza and found ourselves (with 9 yr. old grand daughter) at the mercy of far too many panhandlers who came right up to us and asked for money. My daughter told me "I was born in Santa Fe and feel as if the city has gone downhill."  In order to escape the homeless people pressing in, we went to sit in the Cathedral and listened to choir practice.

data.title: Interesting
data.text: There are lots of things to see including shops, restaurants, and Native Americans selling their wares.  On some weekends it has vendors set up on the grass much like a large art fair.  It is an interesting area that is pleasant to walk around.

data.title: The Plaza of Santa Fe
data.text: The heart of old Santa Fe and center of many events throughout the year. Including Fiestas and Indian market.

data.title: Maybe it just wasn't my thing
data.text: I found the Plaza underwhelming.  The Plaza itself is not particularly pretty.  It's a large piece of grass.  At night, it's really dark.  The shops around the Plaza close extremely early.  The restaurants were mediocre (I tried quite a few).  I live in a city so it might be that I'm used to a little more excitement.  At the end of the night, I was just bored.

data.title: The center, a must see
data.text:
It is obvious, without seeing the Plaza, noone will leave Santa Fe. Everything circles around here, jewelery shops, restaurants, galleries and souvenir shops.
The catthedral is close by sa are important museums.

data.title: Sense of community
data.text: We enjoyed seeing the community gathering around the plaza, families, others, enjoying a beautiful day.
